main event: An unidentified flying object was reported and investigated in the Frick Park area of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on September 12, 1959.
interesting points: The object was found approximately 1.5 feet above the ground and emitted a glowing substance resembling wet paint., The object had a liquid inside it that smelled like ether., Items found with the object included flashlight-type batteries, mercury switches, and a tiny electric motor., The investigation concluded that the object was likely a hoax, orchestrated by students., The Air Force determined that the object did not contain explosives and had never been airborne.
sighted object: unidentified object approximately 18 inches in diameter with a glowing exterior
witness description: Pittsburgh police investigated the reported explosion and object.
